claims.object: one of the main aspects of ecological root theory

surface_layer.definition: Spatial root density distribution is the arrangement of plant roots in a given area.

deep_layer.mechanism: Root distribution is influenced by soil nutrients, water availability, and competition from other plants.
deep_layer.origin: Root systems develop based on environmental conditions and genetic factors.

examples: Higher root density near the soil surface
Decreased root density in compacted soil
